titles.title: Fair Contracts for Growers Act of 2007
A bill to amend title 9, United States Code, to provide for greater fairness in the arbitration process relating to livestock and poultry contracts.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

calendar.text: Committee on the Judiciary. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on the Judiciary. Reported by Senator Leahy without amendment. With written report No. 110-190. Additional and Minority views filed.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 410.

action.text: Star Print ordered on the reported bill.

bill.summary: 10/4/2007--Reported to Senate without amendment. Fair Contracts for Growers Act of 2007 - Amends federal law provisions concerning arbitration to define "livestock," "livestock or poultry contract," "livestock or poultry grower," and "poultry." Allows the use of arbitration to resolve a controversy as provided for under a livestock or poultry contract only if, after the controversy arises, both parties consent in writing to use arbitration. Directs the arbitrator to provide to the parties to the contract a written explanation of the factual and legal basis for an award.
